Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2008 06:00PM 4darmstrong wrote: My eyelashes came out but only part of my eyebrows so all I had to do was fill in with a pencil.  If you get the lace brows be careful about the adhesive.  Chemo can make your skin more sensitive.
Posts.Title: Eyebrows "replacement"? StarWish624 4darmstrong

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2008 04:15PM 4darmstrong wrote: cinlee, My grandchildren and I have had a ball with my "bald-headed head". Paula Young has an online outlet that has extremely good prices.  You may get lucky and find what you're looking for there.  My 6yr and 3 yr grandsons have had a ball wearing my wigs and hats.  At Christmas we decided we could have forgone the toys and bought them hats and wigs instead.  They love rubbing my head and they want me to pull my wig off and show everyone that I'm bald.  The 3 yr old wants me to pick him up at preschool without the wig.  Apparently some of his friends don't believe I'm bald.  My hair started coming out around day 14 and was gone in one week.  I had really thick hair too.  It started growing again within 3 wks after my last tx.  The nurse said it would take 8 or 9 wks.  It was like my body knew we were through with that though.  I have been red-headed for 48 yrs and now I am a brunette.  LOL.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 04:32PM 4darmstrong wrote: I am one day behind you on treatments.  I am experiencing the same se.  The radiation onc. told me that I wouldn't have fatigue either.  But I think they tell us that for our mental state.  Maybe if I wasn't just getting over chemo and surgery it would be easier on my body and mind.
Posts.Title: Upper Body hot and flushed after Rad treatment bdatlanta 4darmstrong

Posts.Content: Feb 29, 2008 01:33PM 4darmstrong wrote: Your sister needs you to be strong right now.  It's okay to worry.  Try not to let her see that though.  I have three sisters, one has been an angel, she brought me some supplements to make sure I was getting all my vitamins and nutrients while I was taking chemo.  Another has taken me to chemo several times.  The third let me live in her house 2 months while ours was being rebuilt. Our house burned after my first treatment.  Now is when you need to pull together as a family.  It's okay to be scared.  I can promise you that your sister is scared.  I am not afraid of dying but I am terrified of being sick and disabled by surgeries and treatments.  Talk to your sister.  Let her know you are worried but will be there for her.  Pray for your sister.
Posts.Title: My sister has breast cancer LOCX leaf

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2008 04:04PM 4darmstrong wrote: Otter, You will do fine.  The pre-meds are wonderful.  I just finished 6 tx of c t and other than mild and transient se's it wasn't that bad. The mast. was much worse.  I go Monday to see about starting rads.  I'm hoping the surgery was the worst part of this circus ride.  I took Prilosec on about day 4 or 5 to help with the indigestion and it seemed to help with the nasty taste.  Ask them to infuse the Taxotere slowly always.  You'll be glad you made the trade off of time vs side effects.  The first treatment I had horrible migraines starting on day 3 but I always got them premenstrually anyway.  My pcp gave me meds that took care of that problem.
